Billie Eilish Says Oscars Performance Was 'Trash' Because She Had a Cold

"I was sick for all of the Oscars, I bombed that performance," she told Apple Music's Zane Lowe in a new interview, in which she appeared to still be under the weather. "That was trash."

Eilish explained that in addition to not feeling physically well, she also felt like the outsider among the Hollywood glitterati.

Billie Eilish also described the writing process for the new James Bond theme song "No Time to Die."

"Two years ago we were like, 'Would it be crazy to make a song for the Bond movies? Like, wouldn't that be dope?'" she said with a laugh.

They kept "subliminally" pitching their take on the British superspy through their music for the past few years, even writing a number of songs they thought sounded Bond-y, but which never came out.

After seeing the first scene of the script, the brother and sister act hunkered down for three days to write the song in Texas and then recorded it in a bunk on their tour bus.
